alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 9:57PM EST until further notice by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Cuyahoga River At Old Portage affecting Summit County. Mahoning River At Warren affecting Trumbull County. Mahoning River At Youngstown affecting Mahoning and Trumbull Counties. Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County. Cuyahoga River At Independence affecting Cuyahoga County. Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Holmes and Wayne Counties. Mahoning River At Leavittsburg affecting Trumbull County. Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Cuyahoga River...including Old Portage, Independence...Major flooding is forecast. For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Mahoning River...including Leavittsburg, Warren, Youngstown...Major flooding is forecast. For the Site Specific Non-forecast Pt...including Phalanx Station... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station. * WHEN...From Thursday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Several homes will become threatened with evacuations possible in the Town of Braceville. Eagle Creek, McConnell East, and Braceville Robinson Roads will be impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 5.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening and continue rising to a crest of 13.6 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.5 feet on 07/11/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning by 1100 AM EST.
